ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 43
ygData.msgSnippet: Hail again fellow EQers Pretty much any time is ok with me as i play often, but if i had to miss a meeting i could just catch the next one, I think (my opinion
ygData.messageBody:
Hail again fellow EQers

Pretty much any time is ok with me as i play often, but if i had to miss a
meeting i could just catch the next one, I think (my opinion only, which i
love to introduce) that we should have a weekly gathering, like every monday
or every thursday from 6-8.. then everyone who is on can come and chat or
whatever.. does this make any sense.. lol

I for one have a very busy schedule and if i knew that every monday nite
everyone would be online i would try and be there, u know what i mean.. ok,
what do u think......

Catt Paladin E'ci
Cami Druid Quell


----- Original Message -----
From: <EQ_women@onelist.com>
To: <EQ_women@onelist.com>
Sent: Sunday, August 08, 1999 10:04 AM
Subject: [EQ_women] Digest Number 43


>

> Message: 1
> Date: Sat, 7 Aug 1999 10:27:11 -0600 (MDT)
> From: Christina Norman <tina@...>
> Subject: List meeting / Guild meeting
>
>
>
> I only got three votes! I'm hoping that means everyone else was ok with
> all the times. I am nervous setting the time for the meeting based on
> only three votes.
>
> I'm going to wait another couple days to let people vote. If all times
> are ok with you, please send me an email saying that. That will let
> reassure me that people will come 8)
>
> I'll post new times, based on feedback from people who can't attend,
> and the delay of another vote taking. I really hope people will come!
>
> Meeting times:
> - Saturday 14th 10am-12pm PST
> - Monday 16th 6-8pm PST
> - Tuesday 17th 6-8pm PST
>
> I hope these times work out for people. Please send in your vote or
> 'all of them are fine' 8)
>
> If you would like to join the guild before that, Luna and Briei (Beth's
> character) are both capable of adding people.
>
> - Christina
>
> ---- Original Message
> -----------------------------------------------------------------------
>
> Hi everyone,
>
> As you may recall Suzanne was organizing an online meeting for mailing
> list. We chatted and agreed that Brell Serelis would be a great server to
> have the meeting on. This way we can all meet eachother, and also have a
> subsequent guild event. The subsequent event would be a newbie hunt,
> during which newbies could hunt critters, and higher level guild members
> could help them out.
>
> I'd like to hold a brief vote on the time and place of the meeting on
> brell. The time matters because we all have different schedules. The
> place only matters in terms of where the newbie hunt will take place.
> Please respond to this email if you have a preference (if you don't care,
> you dont need to respond). If any given meeting time is impossible for
> you, please say that, I'll try and minimize those conflicts.
>
> Meeting places:
> - Greater Faydark stone ring (kelethin newbie zone)
> - East Freeport newbie zone
>
> Meeting times:
> - Tuesday August 10th 6pm-8pm PST
> - Thursday August 10th 6pm-8pm PST
> - Saturday August 14th 10am-12pm PST
>
> Vote will be closed friday at 6pm PST and I'll post the results that
> evening.
>
> I'd like to use the guild chat feature to make our meeting easier. Even
> if you're not planning on playing on Brell, you can make a newbie and join
> the guild, to use this feature. It allows us to send tells to our entire
> guild, so we can hear conversation even if we're not exactly in the same
> physical area.
>
> I'd also like to suggest an unofficial guild hunt Saturday August 7th at
> noon PST. The location will be wherever the official one will be held
> (results posted Friday evening). This is for those of us who'd like to
> get into playing together ASAP.
>
> - Christina
>
>
>
>
____________________________________________________________________________
___
>
____________________________________________________________________________
___
>
> Message: 2
> Date: Sat, 7 Aug 1999 11:00:56 -0600 (MDT)
> From: Christina Norman <tina@...>
> Subject: Online Gaming Gender Rant
>
>
> I think I could write a whole book ranting about online gender
> presentation, assumption of heterosexuality, and how queer people basicly
> get screwed over, but I'll try and make this brief 8)
>
> First of all, let's put Everquest in it's true class: Virtual Reality. It
> may be primitive, but it is virtual reality, and to anyone who's ever had
> someone tap them on the shoulder because they've been talking to you for
> five minutes and you haven't heard a damned thing knows, it's immersive
> virtual reality.
>
> People naturally try and relate to their virtual reality experience like
> they would to their real life experience. This doesn't mean they take
> everything as seriously (otherwise death would reallly suck) but they will
> naturally impose real life qualities in terms of how them form
> relationships and socialize online. These natural social tendancies may
> be modified by concious choice, but at the root they are all there.
>
> People are used to classifying another person's gender. You don't walk up
> to someone on the street (usually) and say "you look like a boy, you act
> like a boy, are you a boy?" We're expected to recognize these qualities,
> classify the person as a boy, and then relate to them as a boy.
>
> People do this same thing naturally in EQ, though not to as an extreme.
> For example:
> - You see a male character, you assume this is a male player, you'd
> probably need to be told outright by the person they were female
> to believe otherwise.
> - You see a female character, things are more complicated:
> - Most people will not try and classify her gender directly I
> think. They'll be aware that most female EQ characters are
> played by males. This introduces gender confusion. They don't
> know how to really deal with a person with a female body but
> a male mind so they'll basicly treat the person like a female
> on the surface, but probably not commit to their gender.
> - If that female character exhibits behavioral characteristics
> that seem female it is very comfortable to allow your gender
> 'no commitment' stance to slip into 'this person is a female
> in real life'.
> - Likewise if this character exhibits male characteristics,
> the person may slip into the assumption the player is male.
> All this avoids the need to ask the person what their gender is.
> - FLIRTING OF ANY KIND is assumed to indicate gender under the
> assumption the player is heterosexual.
> - Some people are aware enough of the complexity of online gender,
> and care enough about real life gender, to skip all this and ask
> (usually to confirm their assumptions)
>
> Queer people get screwed by this in many ways. Lots of people who
> probably wouldn't ID as queer also get screwed.
>
> The above rules are arbitrary, and dumb! They are the rules most people go
> by. If a person decides on your real life gender by these rules, even
> worse if a group of people decide on your gender, their is the fundamental
> assumption that you actively deceived them. Lets not pull punches,
> everyone who decides your gender, when you reveal you are of the other
> gender, will basicly have their entire gender model of you flipped upside
> down. This will create confusion, and potentially hostility. Of course
> anyone who is not a jerk should realize that their assumptions were wrong,
> but most people are jerks about gender.
>
> So what can you do to protect yourself in this environment?
>
> You can be up front about your real-life gender. This will however to
> some degree prevent you from getting into intense gender interaction with
> people as a member of your online perceived gender. Playing a person of
> the opposite gender in EQ is a great way to explore gender in a fun
> environment. Exploring gender is fun and good.
>
> You can be passive about your gender. This is what our list boys have
> done. They let people assume their genders as females, since they didn't
> actively in this way deceive anyone. I think this is perfectly 100% ok.
> Now however they're getting screwed over by the realization that they can
> no longer safely come out without alienating some of their friends.
>
> You can lie outright about your gender. I think this is perfectly ok as
> well. Why? Because you're not hurting anyone. Really the gender / sexual
> orientation hangups of other people is not our problem. Really, our
> gender in real life is irrelevant to the game of Everquest. People
> demand to know real life gender because they have hangups about online /
> real life gender continuity. Tough luck! It's not your responsibility to
> support their environment where they have this kind of knowledge. You
> never aksed to be part of that environment. You can also say "I won't
> answer that question" but people will eventually assume you're not of your
> perceived gender, and they'll mistrust you.
>
> People don't like to lie. They like to be honest, especially with people
> they have good social relationships with. I think it's important to
> realize that an relationship in an online virtual reality is not like a
> real life social relationship. Unless you are going to have some kind of
> real life social relationship with someone online, I think it's perfectly
> reasonable to lie about your gender, your sexual orientation, anything if
> it creates an environment you're more comfortable with.
>
> We are the queer gender-exploring fringe, moving into an online virtual
> environment. The straight heterosexist establishment is imposing on VR
> it's own moral code, but I feel no need to participate in it.
>
> - Christina
>
>
>
>
>
>
>

___

____________________________________________________________________________

> Message: 3
> Date: Sat, 7 Aug 1999 11:03:05 -0600 (MDT)
> From: Christina Norman <tina@...>
> Subject: Re: Online Gaming Gender Rant
>
>
> Whoops, that last message was actually intended for EQ_rainbow, where
> we're having a discussion about when online gender and real life gender
> don't coincide. That's what I get for running two mailing lists 8)
>
> - Christina
>

> Message: 4
> Date: Sat, 07 Aug 1999 13:49:42 -0400
> From: Lora Roa <loraroa@...>
> Subject: Re: List meeting / Guild meeting
>
> The times are fine.
> Kelethin is a bit of a problem since my "goodie" girls are in Qeynos, and
> my chars in the Western Antonica area would not want to be within 20 feet
> of a dying Crushbone Orc ;). (without helping the orc of course). Any
> relief for the "evil among you"?
>
> I do have a young Cleric I made with my last open slot that I'm toying
with
> the idea of tagging her with the guild name, as per the suggestion of
> communicating via guild chat. However as I wanted her to worship Rodcet
> Nife, she started in Qeynos and at 2 would be unable to traverse Highpass
> :(. Should I contanct Luna IG to get her tagged for chat though?
>
> - Lora
> (still abhors the name with its NPC connection, but loves the idea)
> At least 3 of my "bad" girls intend to hunt the NPC sisters ;?
> Though the irony of a female character named Deceit with the "Sisterhood
of
> Erollisi" guild tag hunting the NPC Sisters of Erollisi would be *very*
> amusing.
>

> Message: 5
> Date: Sat, 7 Aug 1999 12:19:13 -0600 (MDT)
> From: Christina Norman <tina@...>
> Subject: Re: List meeting / Guild meeting
>
>
> If you'd like to more easily participate in the chat/social aspect of the
> meeting, why not make a 1st level character whose only purpose is to
> participate in the chat?
>
> As far as real characters go, Luna is hunting in South Karana, so I can
> add you to the guild. Maybe you're far from your sisters now, but when
> you're higher level you can meet up with us.
>
> As far as hunting the Sisters go, this depends on your roleplay
> inclinations. You could just write it off as XP farming and forget about
> it. You could decide you were an infiltraitor of the sisterhood, and make
> sure that any (NPC) sister who saw you fighting another died before she
> could tell the others. No matter what, it's a difficult situation to
> roleplay, but look at it as a challenge 8)
>
> - Christina

> Message: 8
> Date: Sat, 07 Aug 1999 16:18:19 -0400
> From: Lora Roa <loraroa@...>
> Subject: Re: List meeting / Guild meeting
>
> Actually the 2nd level cleric is the low level char, her name is Ysabel
and
> is based in Qeynos. Since, I'm moving to Brell, all 8 slots will be
> "real", but I used my last open to make something that shouldn't have a
> conflict with tagging.
>
> Though I'd love to attend a get together sometime as one of my
> "bad/neutral" girls, perhaps we could alternate meetings between a good
> area (Faydark) and a neutral one? Or at least one where I don't risk
> inappropriate faction hits even if I just stand there. I just don't want
> to risk them becoming KOS in thier hometown/best non-good supply town to
> attend a meeting :( But I'd like to come too :( Even if my idea for
> Ysabel "works" and I end up with one tagged character who will eventually
> get enough exp to travel to Faydark safely, it would be nice for me to
> share my other RPing side with other females on occasion if the get
> togethers end up being regular.
>
> I only pointed that out about Deceit since I found the irony amusing. I
do
> not intend on having that char tagged, unless my RP angle changes with
her.
> Deceit noticed you in S Karana, you also asked her for daggers as Luna
> when they were both in S. Ro a few days ago btw.
>
> - Lora
> (in an neutral/evil RP phase it would seem with 3 DEs, a Troll and an
Ogress)
>

> >> >Hi everyone,

have a
> >> >subsequent guild event. The subsequent event would be a newbie hunt,
> >> >during which newbies could hunt critters, and higher level guild
members
> >> >could help them out.
> >> >
> >> >I'd like to hold a brief vote on the time and place of the meeting on
> >> >brell. The time matters because we all have different schedules. The
> >> >place only matters in terms of where the newbie hunt will take place.
> >> >Please respond to this email if you have a preference (if you don't
care,

for

> >> > - East Freeport newbie zone

> >> > - Thursday August 10th 6pm-8pm PST
> >> > - Saturday August 14th 10am-12pm PST

Even

> Message: 10
> Date: Sat, 07 Aug 1999 16:17:16 -0700
> From: Judy Tyrer <judy3t@...>
> Subject: Re: Marriage
>
> CONGRATULATIONS!
>
> Last night when the East Coast router was down, Corellon could not get on
so we
> chatted in Yahoo instead. The disadvantage was not being able to look
into his
> eyes. The advantage was no interruptive shouts, casting, ooc, auctions
etc.
> *grin* We discussed the honeymoon and both agreed "PG" and he said he is
not a
> minor *really, a BIG concern on my part* so we can play it a little more
adult
> *grin*.
>
> As for the RL thing, we both share the same fear. We got into it a
little, out
> of curiousity, neither of us wanting to lose the fun of the roleplay. He
guessed
> I was 21 *bwahahahahahah* I don't think knowing he was off by 25 years
was the
> best news he heard all night, but on the other hand the roleplay at the
time went
> well. And we had a good time travelling back to Freeport, but got
disconnected
> once there as he smiths and orders started pouring in as soon as he showed
up on
> /w and I got about 10 requests for binds and had bows and arrows to sell
and and
> and - it was like being in a busy city - I hated it *grin*.
>
> I still don't know if it has an effect. This morning started out okay,
then he
> announced he thinks our characters are on the wrong servers and we should
bring
> the humans to Vallon since he doesn't want to be a warrior and lose his
favorite
> weapon to another player (MEN!). I was TOTALLY disappointed as I like my
> Barbarian shaman a lot, even if she is only 4. And before we had a chance
to
> talk, he went afk, then returned with "gotta go" which is more abrupt than
> normal. An old friend had just popped in out of nowhere. So I suddently
felt
> like it HAD mattered, and also feel like I"m overly paranoid.
>
> The good news is I switched to Quellious, met up with one of my
bridesmaids and
> her ranger friend, we hunted and the more I thought the more I realized it
was
> just bad timing. Well, this couple (though not anything but friends they
protest
> overly much all the time *grin*) is also human on Vallon so I think I'll
honor
> Cor's request and we'll move our humans there only instead of being a
cleric to
> his monk, I'm going to be a Druid and Sibonay's little sister. Her
friend,
> Tenadar on Quellious is a monk, Andus, so we'd be matched couples. And
now it
> sounds kind of fun. As all four of us roleplay, we should have a blast.
>
> And if it does affect the roleplay then it is better to find out now,
right? The
> problem is if one partner wants it to evolve into more than it can ever be
and
> the other does not. As it can't on my part, that was my concern (leading
him
> along) and that being settled is probably important. And if he starts
sleeping
> instead of playing with me, it's probabaly a good thing too.
>
> Dnaice, Trisango, Troxfo
>
> (RP doesn't escape any of the complexities of RL, does it <well other than
the
> toilet thing>)
>
>

> > >> Dnaice,
> > >>
> > >> You bring up a bridge that I know I will have to cross eventually

> > >> Wynsong, is very serious about a high elf named Rezok on Fenin
> > Ro. OOC, I know very
> > >> little about the person behind the character save that he's male,
> > a few years younger
> > >> than me, and married (his r/l wife plays a character that is like

> > >> Wynsong). Because I'm very happily married in r/l, very soon into

> > >> I set some expectations that the relationship was rp-only ... which

> > >> the roleplaying is about how the character(s) is perceived in
Norrath.

> > >> honeymoon will be there
> > >> for everyone (us, friends, "family") ... and that's the important

> > >> As a side note ... I did have a marriage on Realm and while the

> > >> just joked around and chatted some more. For the role play, we
